summary.content: I’ve introduced a new section of my website called “Resources”, where I will keep track of excellent articles on XHTML, CSS, web standards, accessibility, and other articles that are important for web designers/developers to keep handy. This section began as part of the “Articles” section, then branched off into it’s own “Propaganda” section, before becoming “Resources”. The most usable part of this section (in my opinion) is the CSS Methods, Techniques, and Hacks area. Many of these are very popularly used Hacks/Methods/etc.

content.html:
I’ve introduced a new section of my website called “Resources”, where I will keep track of excellent articles on XHTML, CSS, web standards, accessibility, and other articles that are important for web designers/developers to keep handy.

This section began as part of the “Articles” section, then branched off into it’s own “Propaganda” section, before becoming “Resources”. The most usable part of this section (in my opinion) is the CSS Methods, Techniques, and Hacks area.

Many of these are very popularly used Hacks/Methods/etc., and might be of great use to many web people out there.
content.plain:
I’ve introduced a new section of my website called “Resources”, where I will keep track of excellent articles on XHTML, CSS, web standards, accessibility, and other articles that are important for web designers/developers to keep handy.
This section began as part of the “Articles” section, then branched off into it’s own “Propaganda” section, before becoming “Resources”. The most usable part of this section (in my opinion) is the CSS Methods, Techniques, and Hacks area.
Many of these are very popularly used Hacks/Methods/etc., and might be of great use to many web people out there.
content.source:
I’ve introduced a new section of my website called [“Resources”](/resources/), where I will keep track of excellent articles on XHTML, CSS, web standards, accessibility, and other articles that are important for web designers/developers to keep handy.

This section began as part of the [“Articles”](/articles/) section, then branched off into it’s own “Propaganda” section, before becoming “Resources”. The most usable part of this section (in my opinion) is the CSS Methods, Techniques, and Hacks area.

Many of these are very popularly used Hacks/Methods/etc., and might be of great use to many web people out there.
